column5: I personally havnt been for lake trout yet.Hoping for tomorrow.But my son and his girlfreind went out the other day.They walked out and pulled a sleigh with there gear. They didnt have to go to far.Spot they targeted had 8" of ice.Trout lakes take a lot longer to freeze and have to still be carefull on them as they always have airholes.Weather has been very mild up here also.They had a fun day catching some nice lakers and just kept 2 for a great meal.Cliff lake was barely fished this summer so that cant hurt with the slow growing lake trout.Pressure is normally very low to begin with.
Nice pics john,nice to see other people holding fish in pictures,but don't give up your modeling career still looks bright haha,the wolf in the picture stalking your son is a great picture also
Thx Rod.Thats his dog.Half huskie/shepherd.Might head out tomorrow for some trout.Going to shack today around 2.Auger runs good but want to test drill couple of holes first.
Beautiful fish! Looks like they had fun...
I won't wish you good luck at the shack you don't need good luck,but good luck with the auger sometimes they can give a guy a headache,I'm sure pictures will come tomorrow lol

Hope this doesnt get zapped.lol.Auger worked great.drilled a couple of holes behind shack.Fishing was excellent used my darter tonight and was very effective.Had 4 walleyes in like 5 min.No big ones all eater size.Fun couple of hrs.Iam afraid that iam in the pics though except one.had a nice cup of coffee with wayne and karla and saw the news .whoa
Enjoyed all the pictures, as usual, good reminders of what amounts to a perk-me-up! Bill
